monogr.title: Panthea: or, Diuine vvishes and meditations: vvritten by Io. Siluester: reuised by I.M. Master of Arts. Whereunto is added an appendix, containing an excellent elegy, written by the L. Viscount St. Albans, late Lord High Chancelour of England. &c
monogr.author: Sylvester, Josuah

div.head: A Muzzle for Hylax in limine latrat. Momus.

lg.l:
IF any (like the
Iohn the second great Duke of Moscouia, so abhor'd Women, that he swoonded at the very sight of them. Bodin, de Repub. Moscouiticke Duke)
Ressent the other Sex, and their iust Praise,

l.hi: Whose Natiue Splendor needs no other Raies;

lg.l: May no such Basiliske dart vpon this Booke

His poisonous Eies: such A most virulent Sycophāt. See Aristophan. Equites: and Thucydides, (lib. 4.) exquisitly rendered by that Worthy learned Gentleman, Mr. The. Hobs, Secretary to the late Excellent Earle of Deuon. Cleon's silenc'd best

l.hi: By Noble Scorne. So set I vp my rest.
